segments.en: And today we're going to be going to one of the least favorite places of many, many people.
segments.cn: 今天我们要去许多人最不喜欢的地方之一。

segments.en: So it must be the dentist.
That place where you have to go every six months, but... You probably don't go.
segments.cn: 那个你每六个月必须去的地方，但... 你可能不去。

segments.en: I know I don't go every six months.
segments.cn: 我知道我不是每六个月去一次。

segments.en: So yeah, we're going to be going to the dentist, and of course we're going to be looking at a lot of great vocabulary related to teeth and all that crazy stuff dentists do.
segments.cn: 所以是的，我们要去看牙医，当然我们会学习很多与牙齿和牙医所做的疯狂事情相关的好词汇。

segments.en: Yes, and we'll also learn some really interesting phrases.
segments.cn: 是的，我们还会学习一些非常有趣的短语。

segments.en: So Marco, let's get started with our vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: Marco，让我们开始我们的词汇预览吧。

segments.en: Okay, in vocabulary preview today we have two words.
segments.cn: 好的，今天的词汇预览有两个词。

segments.en: Let's take a look at the first one.
Okay, so we've seen before this ending ache, right?
segments.cn: 好的，我们之前见过这个以“ache”结尾的词，对吧？

segments.en: So again, a toothache would be... A hurting tooth.
segments.cn: 所以再说一次，牙痛就是... 一颗疼的牙。

segments.en: We can also say stomach ache, headache.
segments.cn: 我们还可以说胃痛，头痛。
几乎所有东西都可以... 疼。
所以我们的下一个词，X光。

segments.en: So when you go to the doctor, many times you'll get an X-ray.
segments.cn: 所以当你去看医生时，很多时候你会做X光检查。

segments.en: It is a picture of your bones.
Alright, well we're going to hear both of these words in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们将在对话中听到这两个词。

segments.en: So why don't we listen as Gary visits his dentist.
segments.cn: 那么我们来听听Gary去看牙医的情况。

segments.en: So tell me what seems to be the problem.
I've got a really bad toothache.
And look, my face is all swollen.
I think it might be my wisdom teeth.
Well, it looks like you have a cavity and your crown is loose.
segments.cn: 嗯，看起来你有蛀牙，牙冠松动。

segments.en: We'll need to put in a filling before it gets any worse.
segments.cn: 我们需要填充一下，以免情况变得更糟。

segments.en: And the crown probably needs to be refitted.
segments.cn: 牙冠可能也需要重新安装。

segments.en: I'm going to order some x-rays.
The dentist says no it's not going to hurt.
But it always hurts much more than he says.
segments.cn: 但总是比他说的疼得多。

segments.en: So in this dialogue we saw some interesting words when the dentist was describing what problems Gary had.
segments.cn: 所以在这个对话中，我们看到了一些有趣的词，当牙医描述Gary的问题时。

segments.en: So why don't we look at those now in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 那么我们现在来看看这些词汇在语言收获中。

segments.en: Alright, let's take a look at our first word.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看第一个词。

segments.en: So Gary said that his face was all swollen.
So swollen is an adjective, right Marco?
segments.cn: 所以肿是一个形容词，对吧Marco？

segments.en: So his face is or was swollen.
segments.cn: 所以他的脸是或曾经是肿的。

segments.en: Yeah, his face was bigger than normal.
Often when you hurt yourself that part of your body becomes swollen.
segments.cn: 通常当你受伤时，身体的那部分会肿。

segments.en: So you have to put some ice on it usually and then the swelling will go down.
segments.cn: 所以你通常需要在上面放一些冰，然后肿胀会消退。

segments.en: The swelling and well the verb to swell.
Alright, three words for the price of one.
So let's listen to some examples of how we would use the swelling, swollen and to swell.
segments.cn: 所以让我们听听如何使用肿胀、肿和肿胀的例子。

segments.en: It's the size of a football.
Put some ice on your foot and the swelling will go down.
segments.cn: 在你的脚上放一些冰，肿胀会消退。

segments.en: I got bitten by a spider and my hand is swelling up.
segments.cn: 我被蜘蛛咬了，我的手在肿胀。

segments.en: Alright, so Gary's face was swollen and he thought that it was his wisdom teeth.
segments.cn: 好吧，Gary的脸肿了，他认为是智齿的问题。

segments.en: So these teeth, they're not knowledgeable but they're called wisdom teeth.
segments.cn: 所以这些牙齿，它们并不聪明，但叫做智齿。

segments.en: They're the teeth that grow last in your mouth, right?
segments.cn: 它们是你嘴里最后长出的牙齿，对吗？

segments.en: Right, they are the last teeth at the very end of your mouth.
segments.cn: 对，它们是你嘴里最后的牙齿。

segments.en: Yes, and usually you get them when you're about 20.
segments.cn: 是的，通常你在20岁左右长出来。

segments.en: And since they come out at this age sometimes they interfere or they hurt a little bit so you have to get them taken out.
segments.cn: 由于它们在这个年龄长出来，有时会干扰或稍微疼痛，所以你必须把它们拔掉。

segments.en: Okay, now for our next word and something that we all got as children.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在是下一个词，我们小时候都有。

segments.en: It's a hole in your tooth.
segments.cn: 这是你牙齿上的一个洞。

segments.en: And it's caused by... Too much sugar.
segments.cn: 这是由... 过多的糖造成的。

segments.en: Or not brushing your teeth enough.
So that's why everyone had it.
segments.cn: 所以这就是为什么每个人都有。

segments.en: I guess I was a bit of a health nut when I was a kid.
segments.cn: 我想我小时候有点健康狂。

segments.en: Alright, but enough about my eating habits.
segments.cn: 好吧，但够了，关于我的饮食习惯。

segments.en: Let's talk about our next word.
We're not talking kings and queens.
segments.cn: 我们不是在谈国王和女王。

segments.en: Right, that's the first thing that comes to mind, right?
segments.cn: 对，这是第一个想到的，对吗？

segments.en: No, a crown is actually the visible part of your teeth.
segments.cn: 不，冠实际上是你牙齿的可见部分。

segments.en: Okay, so there's one part of your tooth that's inside that you can't see, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，所以有一部分牙齿在里面你看不见，对吗？

segments.en: So when he said your crown is loose, what's he talking really about the actual tooth?
segments.cn: 所以当他说你的冠松动时，他实际上是在谈论真正的牙齿吗？

segments.en: So sometimes people will lose a tooth or have a really bad cavity.
segments.cn: 所以有时人们会掉牙或有很严重的蛀牙。

segments.en: So the dentist needs to make a new crown or a new visible part of the tooth for you.
segments.cn: 所以牙医需要为你做一个新的冠或新的可见部分。

segments.en: So sometimes it'll be made of gold.
It's like a really, really, really big filling.
segments.cn: 它就像一个非常非常大的填充物。

segments.en: So his crown needed to be refitted or put back into place.
segments.cn: 所以他的冠需要重新调整或放回原位。
现在是我们的最后一个词。

segments.en: So I just said this word previously.
segments.cn: 所以我刚才说过这个词。

segments.en: Now when you have a cavity, you need to fill it in.
segments.cn: 现在当你有蛀牙时，你需要填补它。

segments.en: Right, you need to fill it with something.
segments.cn: 对，你需要用某种东西填补它。

segments.en: It's usually some sort of paste.

segments.cn: 而且它会变得非常坚硬。

segments.en: So then it covers up this cavity.
segments.cn: 所以它会覆盖这个蛀牙。

segments.en: I wasn't very healthy as a kid.

segments.cn: 好吧，不是个好刷牙的人。

segments.en: So why don't we listen to this dialogue again.
segments.cn: 那我们再听一遍这个对话吧。

segments.en: And then we'll come back and talk a little bit about some of the interesting phrases that the doctor used.
segments.cn: 然后我们再回来谈谈医生使用的一些有趣的短语。

segments.en: So tell me what seems to be the problem.
segments.cn: 那么告诉我，似乎有什么问题。

segments.en: I've got a really bad toothache.
segments.cn: 我有一个非常严重的牙痛。

segments.en: And look, my face is all swollen.
segments.cn: 而且看，我的脸肿得很厉害。

segments.en: I think it might be my wisdom teeth.
Well, it looks like you have a cavity.
We'll need to put in a filling before it gets any worse.
segments.cn: 我们需要在情况变得更糟之前放入一个填充物。

segments.en: And the crown probably needs to be refitted.
segments.cn: 而且冠可能需要重新调整。

segments.en: I'm going to order some x-rays.
segments.cn: 我将要下订单做一些X光。

segments.en: Well, the dentist used three really interesting phrases.
segments.cn: 嗯，牙医使用了三个非常有趣的短语。

segments.en: And I want to look at the first one.
What seems to be the problem?
What seems to be the problem?
Very easy little sentence to ask somebody what's wrong.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常简单的句子，可以问别人怎么了。

segments.en: And these are small, easy words, but when you put them together, they sound really natural and really fluent.
segments.cn: 这些都是简单的词，但当你把它们放在一起时，听起来非常自然和流利。

segments.en: So if you ask somebody what seems to be the problem, it's very polite and it's a very good way of asking what's wrong.
segments.cn: 所以如果你问别人你觉得有什么问题，这非常礼貌，也是询问怎么了的好方式。

segments.en: Our next phrase, also made up of simple words.
segments.cn: 我们下一个短语，也是由简单的词组成。

segments.en: So this is a phrase that maybe your mechanic or your dentist or your doctor will say.
segments.cn: 这个短语可能是你的机械师、牙医或医生会说的。

segments.en: Let's look at it and see what the problem is.
segments.cn: 我们看看问题出在哪里。
好的，我们的最后一个短语。

segments.en: So I can use this phrase for an object, right?
segments.cn: 所以我可以用这个短语形容一个物体，对吧？

segments.en: Like, this house doesn't look good.
segments.cn: 比如，这房子看起来不好。

segments.en: Yes, but here it's used a little bit differently.
segments.cn: 是的，但这里的用法有点不同。

segments.en: So why don't we listen to some examples to help us understand the meaning.
segments.cn: 那我们来听一些例子，帮助我们理解这个意思。

segments.en: John told me it doesn't look good for me.
segments.cn: 约翰告诉我，对我来说看起来不太好。

segments.en: I probably won't get the job.
segments.cn: 我可能得不到这份工作。

segments.en: It doesn't look good for Michael Jackson.
segments.cn: 对迈克尔·杰克逊来说看起来不太好。

segments.en: He's in a lot of debt.
You know, the economy doesn't look very good.
segments.cn: 你知道，经济看起来不太好。

segments.en: Okay, so in the examples we can see that they are using it for the situation.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以在这些例子中，我们可以看到他们是用在情况上的。

segments.en: Yeah, so when you say it doesn't look good, you basically mean there are going to be problems.
segments.cn: 是的，所以当你说看起来不太好时，你基本上是说会有问题。

segments.en: Okay, so great phrases, great words.
segments.cn: 好的，很好的短语，很好的词。

segments.en: Let's listen to our Gary at the dentist one more time.
segments.cn: 让我们再听听加里在牙医那里的对话。

segments.en: Then we'll come back and talk a little bit more.
So, tell me what seems to be the problem.
segments.cn: 那么，告诉我你觉得有什么问题。

segments.en: I've got a really bad toothache.
And look, my face is all swollen.
segments.cn: 而且，看，我的脸肿得很厉害。

segments.en: I think it might be my wisdom teeth.
Well, it looks like you have a cavity and your crown is loose.
segments.cn: 嗯，看起来你有一个蛀牙，牙冠也松了。

segments.en: We'll need to put in a filling before it gets any worse.
segments.cn: 我们需要填充一下，免得情况更糟。

segments.en: And the crown probably needs to be refitted.
segments.cn: 牙冠可能也需要重新安装。

segments.en: I'm going to order some x-rays.
Well, Marco, speaking of dentists, have you ever had an experience like this where you spat out a tooth at the dentist?
segments.cn: 嗯，马尔科，谈到牙医，你有没有过在牙医那里吐出一颗牙的经历？

segments.en: Well, nothing so serious as this, but actually recently when I was in Cambodia... Oh right, you called us in Cambodia.
segments.cn: 嗯，没有这么严重，但实际上最近我在柬埔寨的时候... 哦，对，你在柬埔寨给我们打过电话。

segments.en: Well, our taxi driver offered us to have some local food and he said, well, we're going to have a dog.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们的出租车司机请我们吃当地食物，他说，我们要吃狗。

segments.en: But, you know, if you get around the fact that it's a dog...
segments.cn: 但是，你知道，如果你能接受这是狗...

segments.en: So what does this have to do with your teeth?
segments.cn: 那这和你的牙齿有什么关系？

segments.en: I was eating it and I bit a bone that was hidden and I chipped my tooth.
segments.cn: 我在吃的时候咬到了一个隐藏的骨头，结果崩了我的牙。

segments.en: So you broke part of your tooth?
segments.cn: 所以你把牙的一部分弄坏了？

segments.en: Yeah, like half of it, which I had already chipped before.
segments.cn: 是的，差不多一半，我之前已经崩过。

segments.en: So I had to go to the dentist.
segments.cn: 所以我不得不去看牙医。

segments.en: And so the dentist created a new crown, not with gold or porcelain, but actually with a paste.
segments.cn: 牙医做了一个新的牙冠，不是用金子或瓷器，而是用一种膏状物。

segments.en: And then it becomes hard and it just looks normal.
segments.cn: 然后它变硬，看起来就像正常的。

segments.en: It doesn't even look like I have a fake crown, so to say.
segments.cn: 甚至看起来不像我有假牙冠。

segments.en: But dentists can be really expensive, so how much did this cost?
segments.cn: 但牙医可能真的很贵，那这花了多少钱？

segments.en: Well, this was for the bargain price of $10.
So we should all go to Cambodia for dentistry.
segments.cn: 所以我们都应该去柬埔寨看牙医。

segments.en: Yeah, because actually it was pretty good.
segments.cn: 是的，因为实际上还不错。
不过他看起来真的很年轻。

segments.en: I was kind of scared because when he walked in, he looked like he was 19.
segments.cn: 我有点害怕，因为他走进来的时候，看起来像19岁。

segments.en: But I asked him his age and he was like 30.
segments.cn: 但我问了他的年龄，他说30岁。

segments.en: Yeah, so I imagine that you guys maybe have some dental experiences.
segments.cn: 是的，我想你们可能也有一些牙科经历。

segments.en: So why don't you come to our website and tell us all about it?
segments.cn: 那么，为什么不来我们的网站告诉我们你的经历呢？

segments.en: Yeah, visit us at EnglishPod.com and you can find lots more resources for learning English there.
segments.cn: 是的，访问我们的网站EnglishPod.com，你可以找到更多学习英语的资源。

segments.en: Well, guys, thanks for listening and until next time, bye!
segments.cn: 好吧，感谢大家的收听，下次再见，拜！
